title: Putting Garbage To Good Use: Farmer Collects Plastic Waste From Shops, Uses It To Grow Plants!
text:
We know that the non-disposable plastic in our environment is one of the major causes of almost all kinds of environmental pollution and thus climate change. One of the people who is making a change at a personal level by cutting down plastic pollution is a farmer from Kotumachagi village, Veeresh Negali. Veeresh collects plastic items from places like hotels, grocery stores, pan shops. He asks for unused trays there and plastic bags. He uses this discarded plastic to plant saplings.

He cleans the plastic bags he collects, fills them with mud and organic manure and grows plants. To make the collection of plastic materials easier, he has placed empty boxes in various shops where vendors can put the waste plastic.

All these bags are brought home in the evening by him. He reportedly said, “Bottles, trays, plastic bags used to transport supari and pan masala packets, chocolate bags and others. I collect everything.”

EPS

“It is a small step from my end. My idea is to tell people that throwing away plastics is not the right option as they can be utilized. I collect hundreds of bags daily so that they don’t mix with the soil. I distribute the saplings on birthdays, marriages and school functions. Earlier, shop vendors laughed at me but they started encouraging me after a few days,” New Indian Express quotes him as saying.

He has been doing this for over a year now and he has become famous locally.

“He is a role model and his step towards waste management has received much appreciation. We can help save mother Earth with such simple steps as we avoid dumping poisonous items. He uses organic manure and also encourages others to use the same as well for better yields. We are proud of having such a farmer from our region,” New Indian Express quoted Hema Marad of the Raita Samparka Kendra as saying.
